snippet: The United States, Britain and France discussed the possibility of American-led strikes privately in the days before the attacks linked to Israel, officials said.
abstract: Attacks on Syria, linked to Israel, stoke debate in Washington about whether American-led airstrikes are logical next step to cripple Pres Bashar al-Assad’s government; Sen John McCain asserts that apparent ease with which Israel struck Syria's missile sites has weakened argument that Syria's air defense system would be major challenge to penetrate.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The United States, Britain and France discussed the possibility of American-led strikes privately in the days before the attacks linked to Israel, officials said.

headline.seo: Israeli Attacks on Syria Fuel Debate Over U.S.-Led Airstrikes
headline.main: Israeli Attacks on Syria Fuel Debate Over U.S.-Led Effort
headline.print_headline: Israeli Attacks on Syria Fuel Debate Over U.S.-Led Airstrikes
